genresAdvancedInfo.name: american early music
genresAdvancedInfo.description: This genre refers to the music that was composed and performed in America during the colonial and Revolutionary War periods. It includes a variety of musical styles, such as psalmody, hymns, and ballads. American early music is characterized by its simplicity, harmony, and use of traditional instruments like the fiddle, flute, and guitar.
